newsitem.title: USA: United pays $100 mln extra for MetraHealth.
newsitem.headline: United pays $100 mln extra for MetraHealth.

text.p: United HealthCare Corp said Friday it paid MetraHealth shareholders $100 million in addition to the $1.59 billion purchase price of the company.,
As part of its October 1995 acquisition of MetraHealth, United HealthCare agreed to pay up to $350 million more to MetraHealth shareholders based on its 1995 financial performance.

"When we purchased MetraHealth, we wanted the purchase price to be tied to 1995 financial performance," said Dr. William McGuire, chairman and chief executive officer of United HealthCare, commenting on the payment.
"We believe that the mechanism we used for determining the amount of the earnout was well calibrated so that both United HealthCare and the sellers were satisfied," he said.
United HealthCare offers cost management and other services to healthcare providers.
